main event: On August 6, 1952, William P. Coyne and Stephen A. Kozaik reported photographing a bright light in the sky over Willow Grove, Pennsylvania.
interesting points: The observers photographed the light while walking near the Willow Grove Naval Air Station., The object was visible to the naked eye for about 10 minutes., The resultant photograph depicted a bright streak of light oriented roughly in a north-south direction., Analysts considered potential explanations such as a meteor, aircraft, or satellite but could not definitively identify the object., The case was filed in the Project Blue Book archives for further study and investigation.
sighted object: a bright streak of light in the sky
witness description: William P. Coyne and Stephen A. Kozaik
